attributes.comment:
As a very concerned adoptive parent, I would like to state my strong opposition to
a fee increase in filings related to international adoption. Given the very long wait
most parents endure for their child and the fact that fingerprints and needed
immigration papers expire after 12-18 months, adoptive parents are forced to re-do
many of their USCIS filings. Since there is no "renewal" fee option, we are
required to pay the full fees a second, or even third, time. If the fee increase is
approved, our cost will increase 140% for a second filing of the I600A form and
new fingerprints alone. I would ask that you consider lengthening the validity
period for these forms once approval is granted or offering a reduced fee for
renewals. Please, do not place an unfair burden on adoptive parents.

Sincerely,
Paula Davis
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Paula Davis
